III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency has been bullying and harassing youth residing at facility.
There have been inappropriate relationships between staff and
youth. There have been instances of racial and religious
discrimination. The agency has been withholding necessary
information for youth to contact their case managers. The youth
are threatened with eviction.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
MDHHS Worker was interviewed by phone 4/7/2025. She
reported having made face to face contacts with the minor youths
named in the allegation, Youth B and Youth C, at the agency’s
independent living home, Tillman House, on 4/4/2025. She
reported the concerns the youths expressed to her were primarily
licensing and not abuse/neglect related. She stated the youths
clarified the staff “bullying” was verbal and not physical. They
described an incident they felt was discriminatory when House
Manager made a comment about a Muslim youth, Youth D, who is
no longer living at the home, they felt was insensitive. They
described the maintenance man as “creepy” but did not disclose
any sexually inappropriate interactions. MDHHS Worker reported
the youths reported the staff member they feel safe with is the
House Manager, who was previously named in the allegation as
the staff member being verbally abusive to the youth. Also,
MDHHS Worker stated the name given in the allegation as the
maintenance man is not the maintenance man, rather a different
staff member.
A follow-up discussion was had with MDHHS Worker about the
agency response plan. She reported she developed a plan with
the youths, but she did not develop anything with the agency as
the youths identified the same staff member the allegation
indicated bullied and verbally abused them as the staff member
that they feel the safest with. Additionally, the person named as
the maintenance man, Maintenance Man, in the allegation is not
the maintenance man. MDHHS Worker reported forensic
interviewing with the youth will be scheduled at a local children’s
2

advocacy center and no additional interviews can be completed
until those interviews take place.
On 4/29/2025, MDHHS Worker sent an email stating forensic
interviews with Youth B and Youth C were scheduled to occur at a
local children’s advocacy center; however, a supervisor at the
children’s advocacy center indicated I was unable to attend the
interviews because I am not investigating abuse or neglect.
MDHHS Worker provided her notes from those interviews which
took place 5/1/2025.
Youth B stated a lot of the youths in the home are
mistreated and there is a lot of racism. She described the
male employees at the agency as “weird.” She stated
Maintenance Man is not supposed to come into the youth’s
rooms when they are present. She stated if he needs to
come into their room they are supposed to leave, but Youth
A told Youth B Maintenance Man came into her room while
she was there. Youth B stated there was a time in February
when she went into the kitchen to use the microwave and
Maintenance Man was standing in the hallway looking at
her, which made her uncomfortable. She stated he was
looking her up and down. Youth B stated that when she first
moved into the home, Maintenance Man was bringing
some things to her room when she was in the room. She
stated she felt he was doing things to remain near her.
Youth B reported she heard from another youth that
Maintenance Man told Youth D she looked beautiful once
when she was wearing a dress. Youth B reported she told a
staff member she was uncomfortable with Maintenance
Man and that staff member told House Manager. House
Manager spoke to Youth B about her concerns and told her
the way Maintenance Man looked at her should not have
made her uncomfortable.
Youth B also reported she feels Foster Care Worker had an
inappropriate relationship with Youth D. She stated Youth D
bought Valentine’s Day gifts for her boyfriend which made
Foster Care Worker angry. She stated she could tell Foster
Care Worker was angry because of his body language and
the tone of his voice. Youth B reported Foster Care Worker
kicked Youth D’s things during this interaction. Youth B
stated Youth A told her there was time she was in the
kitchen with Youth D and Foster Care Worker. Foster Care
Worker tried to wipe Youth D’s tears while she was cutting
onions and also tried to wash her hands for her after.
3

Youth B reported she has not been touched inappropriately
at the agency, and she has not heard of or seen anyone
else be touched inappropriately.
Youth C reported she has not experienced any harassment
or bullying, but Youth A and Youth D were harassed and
bullied by staff members. Youth C stated Youth D was also
harassed by Foster Care Worker. She stated Foster Care
Worker got mad and kicked Youth D’s things when she was
talking about something she bought for her boyfriend.
Youth D reported she feels Foster Care Worker is overly
involved. She reported Foster Care Worker will turn the
water on for them when they do the dishes and will wipe
the counter for them when they are already washing it off.
Youth C reported she believes Foster Care Worker does
these things to get closer to Youth D.
Youth C reported Maintenance Man has made her
uncomfortable by the way he stares at her. She stated one
morning she went to the kitchen for water and Maintenance
Man was in the kitchen area. She stated he was staring at
her and she felt he was looking at her body.
Youth C reported she has not been touched inappropriately
at the agency, and she has not heard of or seen anyone
else be touched inappropriately.
Youth C reported she does not feel there is much physical
harassment but there is verbal and emotional harassment
from staff. She stated staff members are disrespectful and
dismissive. She reported there is a complaint system for
youth to file incident reports, but nothing is done about their
concerns. She stated House Manager called Youth D a
“fake Arabic” and made fun of her appearance after which
the youths spoke to House Manager about her comments
being offensive, but House Manager did not care. She
stated House Manager does not control the staff, but later
stated she feels safe when House Manager is present.
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 6/6/2025. She reported
previously living at Tillman House. She stated Youth D was living
at the home with her and Foster Care Worker was having an
inappropriate relationship with Youth D. She stated Foster Care
Worker would treat Youth D like she was incapable while
practicing independent living skills such as cooking and would
help her wipe her face and wash her hands. She reported being
4

told Foster Care Worker took gifts Youth D bought for her
boyfriend and threw them on the floor and kicked them. Youth A
stated Youth D had a former foster parent try to touch her
inappropriately and Foster Care Worker asked her if she was
dressed inappropriately when this happened.
In response to being asked about the allegations of racism,
discriminations, and bullying in the home, Youth A stated Youth D
told her about feeling discriminated against. Youth A stated she
believed Youth D because she was the only Muslim youth in the
home. Youth A reported being Hebrew and stated they were
sitting down with the other youths and House Manager at
Christmas and House Manager asked everyone who they
worship. Youth A stated this made her and Youth D uncomfortable
and the other youths laughed at them.
Youth B was interviewed in person at the agency on 5/22/2025.
Her interview was conducted along with MDHHS Worker. She
stated she did not have want to make any changes or add any
additional information to the interviews conducted on 5/1/2025.
She stated if she sees Maintenance Man, she turns and goes the
other direction.
Youth C was interviewed in person at the agency on 5/22/2025.
Her interview was conducted along with MDHHS Worker. She
stated she did not have any additional information related to her
previous interview other than she recently got into a verbal
altercation with a staff member.
Youth D previously lived at Tillman House. A voicemail requesting
a return call was left 6/6/2025 at the phone number provided by
Youth A. Another call was made to the same phone number on
6/12/2025 at which time the call went straight to a message
stating the user had not set up a mailbox.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed in person at the agency on
5/22/2025. His interview was conducted along with MDHHS
Worker. He reported Youth A was on his caseload prior to her
discharge from the program. He stated he was interviewed by a
detective about the allegations that he was in an inappropriate
relationship with youths in the home. He stated he has been with
Youth A one-on-one many times and she had never made any
allegations against him. Foster Care Worker stated he put the
heat on Youth A about not doing her schoolwork after which these
allegations were made. He stated Youth A has turned his
interactions with the youth’s into being described as inappropriate
5

and/or grooming behaviors. He stated when he was in the kitchen
with Youth D while she was cutting onions, he told her it was
going to make her cry. He denied ever wiping her tears or face in
any manner. He stated Youth D bought several expensive gifts for
her boyfriend for Valentine’s Day and Foster Care Worker
commented on the amount of money she spent stating she should
be saving her money. He denied being jealous of the gifts or
kicking anything during this interaction. Foster Care Worker stated
he always announces himself when he enters the home or a
youth’s room as the youths living in the home are all female. He
stated he never enters a youth’s room unless there is another staff
member present who knows he is entering the room. He stated he
makes it a mission to never put himself in a position in which
youths could make allegations against him.
Maintenance Man was interviewed in person at the agency on
5/22/2025. His interview was conducted along with MDHHS
Worker. He stated he rarely interacts with the youths and tried to
stay out of the building unless other staff members are present.
He stated if he needs to repair something in a youth’s room, he
will have them step out of the room before he goes in. He stated
the youths are supposed to tell the home’s staff members if they
have maintenance request and the staff will write the maintenance
request in a book. If a youth tells him about something they need
done directly he will redirect them to tell staff. He stated if
something needs to be done in a youth room, he will have staff
member come with him and knock on the youth’s door. The staff
member will ask the youth to step out and he will go into the room.
He stated if something like a doorknob or something needs to be
fixed a staff member will stand with him while he makes the repair.
Program Manager was interviewed in person at the agency on
5/22/2025. She stated there has been no disciplinary action or
concerns related to these allegations for Foster Care Worker,
Maintenance Man, or House Manager.
House Manager was interviewed by phone on 5/28/2025. Her
interview was conducted along with MDHHS Worker who was in-
person with House Manager. House Manager stated the
allegations are “baffling.” She stated Maintenance Man does not
enter the building unless a staff member is present. House
Manager reported when Foster Care Worker enters the building
he will call out “man on the floor.” She did not report any concerns
with their interactions with the youths in the home.
6

House Manager stated she did not know why there were
allegations of bullying and racism. She stated she made a
comment to Youth D about her religion. House Manager stated
Youth D would leave the building in her religious attire at 11:00pm
during Ramadan stating she was going to her mother’s, then
would come back high and smelling like marijuana. House
Manager stated she told Youth D she was a part-time Muslim
because she was using her religion to leave the house past
curfew and get high. She stated Youth D would post times on her
door that she could not be bothered because she was in prayer
which she had never done prior to meeting another youth in the
home. She stated she felt Youth D was using her religion to break
house rules because she knew House Manager could not do
anything about it.
MDHHS Worker held a conference call on 5/29/2025 during which
she reported there were no findings. She also reported the law
enforcement officer who was investigating closed out their case.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
MDHHS Worker provided a safety plan she developed with the
Youth B and Youth C on 4/4/2025 which stated:
• Youth B & Youth C will inform staff members or
caseworkers if they feel unsafe
• Youth B & Youth C will not be alone with any men
• Youth B & Youth C will report any bullying or harassment in
the home
• Youth B & Youth C will contact law enforcement if
necessary
Tillman House Supportive Housing Handbook which states:
• Any issues of maintenance should be reported to Youth
Advocates or House Manager who will notify maintenance
department.
• Maintenance will provide 24-hour notice if they have to
enter room except in the case of emergencies requiring
immediate access.
Analysis No violation is established as the there is no evidence to support
the allegations of inappropriate relationships with youths and staff,
discriminations, racism, harassment, or bullying. While House
Manager’s comment about Youth D being a part-time Muslim
7

could be perceived as insensitive, it does not rise to the level of
House Manager not being of responsible character.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
Section • (2) The policies and procedures must cover at least all the
Description following areas:
• (f) Amount of financial support and how it is
disbursed. An agency may not withhold financial
support intended for the youth while the youth is
actively involved in the program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are withholding state financial assistance checks from the
youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
MDHHS Worker was interviewed by phone 4/7/2025. She
reported having made face to face contacts with the minor youths
named in the allegation, Youth B and Youth C, at the agency’s
independent living home, Tillman House, on 4/4/2025. She
reported the concerns the youths expressed to her were primarily
licensing and not abuse/neglect related. MDHHS Worker reported
forensic interviewing with the youth will be scheduled at a local
children’s advocacy center and no additional interviews can be
completed until those interviews take place.
On 4/29/2025, MDHHS Worker sent an email stating forensic
interviews with Youth B and Youth C were scheduled to occur at a
local children’s advocacy center; however, a supervisor at the
children’s advocacy center indicated Division of Child Welfare
Consultants cannot attend the interviews because they are not
investigating abuse or neglect. MDHHS Worker provided her
notes from forensic interviews which took place 5/1/2025.
Youth B reported the youths living in Tillman House get
approximately $274 every two weeks from which they pay
rent and bills to the agency leaving them with $20 to buy
food and other items. She stated there have been times
when she didn’t have enough money for food, but the other
youths in the home make sure she eats. She stated, since
this investigation started, the home’s pantry has been
stocked, which it wasn’t in the past.
Youth C reported the youth living at Tillman House are
required to live off $200 every two weeks. She stated if they
go into another youth’s room or if they don’t clean their own
8

rooms, they get fined $25. She stated House Manager will
withhold checks if youths do not meet with her. She added
this has not happened to her, but it has to other youths.
She stated the agency stole $600 from Youth D when
Youth D left.
Youth A was interviewed by phone on 6/6/2025. She reported
previously living at Tillman House. She did not report any
concerns related to her finances and stated she reported concerns
because of things happening to Youth D.
Youth B was interviewed in person at the agency on 5/22/2025.
Her interview was conducted along with MDHHS Worker. The only
additional information regarding finances she provided was that
agency staff recently implemented a new rule that the youths will
be fined $25 for being in the doorway of another youth’s room.
Youth C was interviewed in person at the agency on 5/22/2025.
The only additional information regarding finances she provided
was that agency staff recently fined her for wearing shorts they
thought were inappropriate.
Youth D previously lived at Tillman House. A voicemail requesting
a return call was left 6/6/2025. Another call was made to the same
phone number on 6/12/2025 at which time the call went straight to
a message stating the user had not set up a mailbox.
House Manager was interviewed by phone on 5/28/2025. Her
interview was conducted along with MDHHS Worker who was in-
person with House Manager. She stated there was a youth at the
agency who did not like the agency fining system. She stated
youths are fined $50 for smoking in the house and $25 for missing
curfew, visiting other youths’ rooms, continuously having a dirty
room, and not going to school for more than 3 consecutive days
without being sick. House Manager stated the fines go into the
youth’s savings account which is provided to the youth at program
discharge. House Manager stated youths are provided their
stipend checks and pay their bills from those checks.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
Tillman House Fine sheet which states the following fines will be
placed in the youth’s saving which will be given to the youth when
their time in the program is over:
• 3 days consistent messy room $25
• Missing Curfew/AWOL $25 (per instance, subject to
increase)
9

• Visiting in the room $25
• Missing 2 days of school in week without valid reason $25
• A fine of $50 will be placed in the house fund for smoking in
the home as it will be considered vandalism.
Tillman House Supportive Housing Handbook which states:
• Youths will receive a stipend bi-weekly for
transportation, personal needs, clothing, and food.
• Youths are expected to maintain employment to
supplement the stipend.
• The youth’s foster care worker may withhold the
check if the youth fail to attend school daily,
maintain employment, meet with the life skills coach,
or if the youth AWOLs from the home.
• Youth are to not leave their rooms dressed
inappropriately between the hours of 9:00am and
5:00pm
Analysis No violation is established as the youth report receiving their
stipend checks and being fined as outlined in the agency
documents.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
